instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message:
Green light - Ok
SMC_RESET_L - 3.3V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN - 3.3V
PP3V3_S5  - 3.3V stable
32khz  PCH - present
PM_RSMRST_L (Reset PCH) - - 3.3V
RTC_RESET_L (Reset RTC) - - 3.3V

5V_S3 - can check a pulse each 8 seg.
5V_S3 COIL diode mode -> 0.149 and 1.09

Bios and clock chip looks good.

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message: Yes, but very well cleaned. About thunderbold chip and ISL6259 chip.

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message: PPBUS voltage? Are other rails pulsing too?

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message:
PPBUS - 12.60V
PP1V8_S0 - pulsing too
PPCPUVCCIO - pulsing too
PP1V5_S3 pulsing too but it goes slowly to 1V and each 8 seg goes to 1.5V
CPU CORE - 0V
PP1V05_S0 - Pulsing too
PPVCCSA_S0_CPU - Pulsing too
ALL_SYS_PWRGD - Pulsing too
I removed R7974 but no results.

Some chip short ALL_SYS_PWRGD to grounf and SMC shutdown the board? Is that what happend?

----

If I remove U2850
PM_S0_PGOOD - 0.10V
CPUIMVP_PGOOD - pulsing
ALL_SYS_PWRGD - still pulsing

So, it is not CPU power supply and PCH as I see.

Cannot find U7980 and Q7970 on boardview to test more.

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message: R7402 is 90K. I replaced u2800 and I have 5V stable and cpu core stable. CPU got hot. No mouse light...

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message: No idea, could be corrosion anywhere at this point. SMC/PCH are first suspects.

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message: I took bios chip from donor board and power only 2 times with light in the mouse. Reflow PCH with flux to 180° is good idea?

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message:
SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB - 22Mhz
SYSCLK_CLK25M_ENET - 25Mhz

Thas 22mhz are ok I that could be a problem??

threads.title: 5V_S3 pulsing each 8 seg
threads.message: No more ideas with this one besides what I told before.
